name: BASMAH
mission: When you brighten a life, you ignite change that extends far beyond one person. Each individual touched goes on to inspire and uplift those around them, creating a ripple effect of hope and transformation. At BASMAH, we are committed to brightening as many lives as possible—because every life changed brings the world one step closer to a brighter future.
theoryOfChange: Empowering people through education and vocational skills to enable long-term stability and self-sufficiency rather than just short-term relief.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://basmah-bd.org/zakat (Source: https://basmah-bd.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

all_citations.claim: The charity is Zakat-eligible and maintains specific policies for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,195,860 and holds 0.8 months of working capital.
The organization operates medical centers, educational facilities, and orphan centers for refugees.
The charity provides various giving methods to support its humanitarian mission and refugee aid.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid 73/100 due to its high alignment with humanitarian causes and efficient fundraising, though its overall score is tempered by low working capital reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 0.8 months of working capital available
Need for increased financial reserves to ensure long-term operational stability

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high alignment (43/50) for Muslim donors as it is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific policy for distributing funds according to asnaf categories [1]. The mission addresses urgent humanitarian needs within the Rohingya refugee crisis, creating a strong fit for donors prioritizing relief and education [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: BASMAH demonstrates a moderate impact score of 32/50 by providing direct services such as medical care and orphan support at a calculated cost of approximately $14.42 per beneficiary [3]. While the organization successfully managed a total revenue of $4,195,860, its financial health is constrained by having only 0.8 months of working capital [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Bangladesh American Society of Muslim Aid for Humanity Inc (BASMAH) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development programs for Rohingya refugees and underserved communities in Bangladesh.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Direct service model providing essential healthcare and education to refugees
baseline_narrative.summary: BASMAH focuses on long-term stability by operating medical centers, educational facilities, and orphan centers to empower individuals to help themselves [3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $4,195,860 to support its international aid initiatives [2].

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently maintains only <cite id="13">0.8 months of working capital</cite>, which creates risk for program continuity during funding fluctuations.
With a <cite id="14">board size of only 3 members</cite>, the organization could benefit from diversifying its leadership to enhance oversight.

bbb_assessment.summary: BASMAH is a <cite id="5">BBB Accredited Charity</cite>, indicating it meets standards for accountability and reporting.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The charity's rapid <cite id="11">42.1% revenue growth</cite> suggests strong donor support, which may offset immediate liquidity risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="13">Working capital of 0.8 months</cite> poses a risk to program continuity
<cite id="14">Small board size (3 members)</cite> limits governance diversity
case_against.summary: The primary concern is financial sustainability; the organization has <cite id="13">less than one month of operating reserves</cite>.

confidence.notes: Strong transparency signals from Candid Platinum status.

known_gaps: Incomplete expense breakdown in financial data

alignment.explanation: BASMAH is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="8">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="16">asnaf categories including the poor and needy</cite> in crisis zones.
alignment.improvement: The organization could further improve alignment by <cite id="12">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust BASMAH due to its <cite id="4">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and <cite id="5">BBB Accreditation</cite>, which verify its commitment to public disclosure and ethical standards.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="14">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond the current three members to improve independent oversight.

impact.explanation: The charity achieves an <cite id="9">exceptional cost per beneficiary of $14.42</cite> through a direct service model that includes <cite id="10">WASH, education, and feeding programs</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact could be improved by <cite id="13">increasing operating reserves</cite> to at least 3 months to ensure long-term stability and <cite id="15">documenting a formal theory of change</cite>.

rich_narrative.headline: The Bangladesh American Society of Muslim Aid for Humanity Inc (BASMAH) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development programs for Rohingya refugees and underserved communities in Bangladesh.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support direct humanitarian aid for Rohingya refugees and value high transparency through Candid Platinum-rated organizations.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with a verified organization
Prioritize low-overhead organizations where $0.00 is spent on fundraising
Care about the Rohingya refugee crisis and healthcare in Bangladesh
Value direct service delivery over advocacy
giving_considerations: The organization is in a high-growth phase with a 42.1% CAGR
Low financial reserves mean your donation is likely deployed immediately
Governance is currently centralized within a small board
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with large financial endowments or those who prefer established institutions with decades of history.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that the organization <cite id="15">tracks outcome metrics</cite> and has a documented theory of change, but lacks independent RCT-level evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: BASMAH aims to empower individuals by providing <cite id="2">immediate relief and long-term stability</cite> through education and healthcare.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that direct service programs like medical centers are effectively improving beneficiary health outcomes.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With <cite id="11">42.1% revenue growth</cite> and expanding operations in <cite id="12">multiple crisis zones</cite>, the charity can absorb significant new funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="7">unusually high fundraising efficiency</cite> and a <cite id="11">42.1% growth rate</cite> compared to established peers.

strengths.detail: The organization reports a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating that it does not incur traditional fundraising costs to generate its $4.2M revenue.
BASMAH holds a <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and is a <cite id="5">BBB Accredited Charity</cite>, meeting rigorous standards for governance.
The charity demonstrates strong value for money with a <cite id="9">cost per beneficiary of approximately $14.42</cite> for its humanitarian interventions.

strengths_deep_dive: BASMAH's operational model is built on <cite id="6">direct service delivery</cite>, which allows for greater control over outcomes and costs. By managing its own <cite id="10">medical centers and educational facilities</cite> in the Rohingya refugee camps, the organization bypasses many third-party administrative layers. This efficiency is reflected in their <cite id="11">3-year revenue CAGR of 42.1%</cite>, showing rapid growth and an increasing ability to absorb and deploy capital in high-need areas like <cite id="12">Bangladesh, Palestine, and Syria</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2018, the Bangladesh American Society of Muslim Aid for Humanity Inc (BASMAH) is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">critical healthcare and education to Rohingya refugees</cite> and underserved communities in Bangladesh. The organization operates with a vision of <cite id="2">empowering individuals to achieve long-term stability</cite> through sustainable development rather than just short-term aid. In the 2023 fiscal year, BASMAH reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $4,195,860</cite>, representing a significant expansion of its service capacity. The charity maintains a <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure available, and has been recognized as an <cite id="5">Accredited Charity by the Better Business Bureau</cite>. Its operations are primarily focused on <cite id="6">direct service delivery</cite>, including the management of medical centers, orphan centers, and educational facilities. BASMAH is particularly notable for its <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are maximized for program delivery. The organization also serves as a vital bridge for Muslim donors, maintaining a <cite id="8">verified zakat-eligible status</cite> with clear policies for distribution among the poor and needy.
